tools.name: api-health
tools.description: Checks the health and availability of Veracode API endpoints

tools.name: get-dynamic-findings
tools.description:
Get runtime vulnerabilities from DYNAMIC analysis scans.

Returns: Auth/session flaws, authorization bypasses, misconfigurations, CSRF, clickjacking, missing headers
Includes: CWE ID, URL, HTTP details, attack vectors, severity, status
Related: get-static-findings (source code)

Display as table: | Flaw ID | Severity | CWE | Status | URL | Description |

params.name: application_path
params.description: Argument for the *ABSOLUTE PATH* to the application directory or workspace to scan. The path MUST be absolute and have the correct path separator. You can retrieve the absolute path by invoking `pwd` on the command line in the working directory. Example: `/a/my-project` on linux/macOS or, on Windows `C:\\a\my-project`.

params.name: app_profile
params.description: Application Profile GUID or name to get findings for. If not provided, will automatically check .veracode-workspace.json for the default profile. RECOMMENDED: Call get-workspace-profile first to check if a default exists before calling this tool without app_profile.

params.name: sandbox
params.description: Sandbox GUID or name to get findings from. If not specified, returns findings from policy scan (production). Use this to get findings from development/testing sandbox environments.

params.name: severity
params.description: Filter findings by severity levels. Example: ["Very High", "High"] for critical findings only.

params.name: status
params.description: Filter findings by remediation status (filtered in MCP Server after API fetch - Veracode API does not support status filtering). Example: ["NEW", "OPEN"] for unresolved findings. Note: Pagination counts may be affected.

params.name: cwe_ids
params.description: Filter findings by specific CWE IDs. Example: ["79", "89"] for XSS and SQL injection.

params.name: violates_policy
params.description: Filter by policy violation status. Set to true to show ONLY findings that violate policy and MUST be fixed before the scan will pass. Set to false to show findings that do not violate policy. Critical for prioritization and compliance workflows.

params.name: page
params.description: Page number for pagination (0-based). Use for large result sets. Default is 0.

params.name: size
params.description: Number of findings per page (1-500). Default is 100. Use smaller values for faster responses.

params.name: include_mitigations
params.description: Include mitigations (proposed/approved/rejected comments) for findings. Default is false. Mitigations represent risk-lowering measures, not complete remediation.

tools.name: get-static-findings
tools.description:
Get source code vulnerabilities from STATIC analysis scans.

Returns: XSS, SQL injection, crypto issues, race conditions, buffer overflows, unsafe functions
Includes: CWE ID, file path, line number, severity, status
Related: get-dynamic-findings (runtime)

Display as table: | Flaw ID | Severity | CWE | Status | File:Line | Description |
